intro: Trinia elatior, commonly known as the tall trinia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it blooms throughout the growing season. Trinia elatior is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
